comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Sikorsky JRS-1 1-J-5, probably c/n 4338 BuNo 1055 of VJ-1. Utility Squadron One was based at NAS Pearl Harbor, and after the December 7, 1941 Japanese attack the unit struck out in search of the enemy carriers. Reportedly on JRS got within 50 miles of the enemy fleet but was driven off by fighters. 1085 was struck off charge on 7-23-43. Below is a Vought UO-1.
